question: Which of the following represent the qualifications needed to be appointed as a judge of the Supreme Court?
option1: The person should have been a judge of a High Court for five years
option2: The person should have been an advocate of a High Court
option3: The person should be a distinguished jurist in the opinion of the president
explanation: To be appointed as a judge of the Supreme Court a person should have the following qualifications: (1) He should be a citizen of India, (2) He should have been a judge of a High Court (or high courts in succession) for five years; or he should have been an advocate of a High Court (or High Courts in succession) for ten years; or he should be a distinguished jurist in the opinion of the president.
